titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison--LUCY, a dark griffe, 5 feet high, aged about 50 years; says she belongs to Mrs. Barry, or the Carroll-ton Railroad Company. CAREY, a dark griff, 5 feet 8 inches high, about 62 years old, has a scar on his right cheek; says he belongs to Mr. Kline. NED, a light griff, 5 feet 9 inches high, aged about 23 years; says he belongs to Mr. Cox on Bayou Lafourche. JIM, a dark griff, 5 feet 8 inches high, aged about 31 years; says he belongs to Mr. Cox on Bayou Lafourche. The owners will please comply with the law in regard to them. J. WORRELL, Warden. New Orleans, July 20, 1851. jy22 1aw3w
mods.note: Mrs. Barry or the Carrollton Railroad Company; Mr. Kline; Mr. Cox
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
